humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the patient has metastatic carcinoma in at least one of the two sentinel lymph nodes (Rule 1, Rule 8). The specific number of positive lymph nodes is not provided, but based on the information given, the N stage would be N1 (New Rule 12).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has metastatic adenocarcinoma in the right axillary sentinel lymph nodes (A.) and right axillary contents (C.), with a total of 12 probable lymph nodes found in the axillary contents. This information supports the N1 stage, which is defined as 'Metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes or in infraclavicular (clavicular) lymph nodes.' (TNM staging system, American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition). The exact number of positive lymph nodes is not specified, but the presence of metastasis in at least one lymph node is confirmed. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
